citations.narrative:
Upon review of the primary enclosure housing a white fox, inspectors noticed a few day's worth of excreta collection on
the floor. The fox was seen laying on top of excreta as it was everywhere on the enclosure. The excreta was dry and flies
were seen on the pellets. Collection of excreta can harbor diseases, pests, and odors. Excreta shall be removed from
primary enclosures as often as necessary to prevent contamination of the animals contained therein and to minimize
disease hazards and to reduce odors. When enclosures are cleaned by hosing or flushing, adequate measures shall be
taken to protect the animals confined in such enclosures from being directly sprayed with the stream of water or wetted
involuntarily.
This inspection and exit interview were conducted with Facility Representative.
Additional Inspectors:
MARIO MERCADO, VETERINARY MEDICAL OFFICER n
